III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction, prevention;
Title prohibited restraints; elimination of restraints.
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159
Section (5) In the event a restraint occurs, it must be performed in a
Description manner that is safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the severity
of the youth’s behavior, chronological and developmental age,
size, gender, physical condition, medical condition, psychiatric
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Unknown staff restrained Youth A and caused multiple bruises
and scratches on Youth A.
Investigation On 6/25/24, I spoke to DHHS Worker 1; scheduling and
allegations were discussed.
On 6/27/24, I left a voicemail for Complainant 1. Phone call was
not returned.
On 6/27/24, I left a voicemail to Foster Care Worker 1. Phone call
was not returned.
On 6/25/24, the following interviews were conducted face to face
at the facility:
Staff 1:
Staff 1 reported Youth A was restrained on 6/24/24. Staff 1
reported he was not assigned to the same unit where Youth A
resides but did come over to assist. Staff 1 reported Youth A was
walking around the campus and threw tables and outside grills.
Staff 1 reported both, Supervisor 1 and Staff 2 were near Youth A.
Staff 1 reported as he walked towards them it appeared as if
Youth A was getting ready to punch Supervisor 1. Both Supervisor
1 and Staff 2 initiated a restraint, and they placed Youth A on the
ground. Staff 1 reported he then went to help restrain Youth A by
holding his legs. Youth A’s arms were held to the ground by both
Supervisor 1 and Staff 2. While on the restraint, Youth A was
agitated and took approximately 20 minutes to deescalate. Staff 1
reported he did not have any concerns about how the restraint
was completed. Staff 1 reported he did not see any marks or
2

bruises on Youth A and denied anyone used inappropriate
language towards Youth A.
Supervisor 1:
Supervisor 1 reported he started his shift at 3:30pm on 6/24/24.
Youth A demanded that staff supervising him for the day be
changed and he be permitted to go on an outing. When told, “no”,
Youth A left the building and began walking around the campus,
flipping picnic tables and throwing outside grills. Supervisor 1
reported he began to follow Youth A, and Staff 2 joined him.
Youth A stopped in front of one of the residential buildings
(shelter) and continued to knock over grills and tables. Youth A
verbally threatened staff, stating he is going to “beat their ass.”
Youth A came towards them with his fist clenched and made
verbal threats to them. Supervisor 1 reported he attempted to
place Youth A into a standing hold, lost his footing due to the
uneven ground and they fell to the ground. Supervisor 1 reported
both he and Staff 2 held his arms down in the floor restraint
position. Supervisor 1 reported Youth A did struggle in the
restraint and yelled and threatened while on the restraint.
Supervisor 1 reported he did not grab Youth A’s neck or choke
him, nor did he see anyone else do this. Supervisor 1 reported
Youth A is an aggressive youth and does not do well when told
“no.” Supervisor 1 reported once Youth A is escalated, he usually
is unable to deescalate without some form of aggression.
Supervisor 1 was able to verbalize the different methods to help
deescalate Youth A, yet Youth A was already in an outburst.
Supervisor 1 reported Youth A did have a “nick” on his right eye
and on neck but accounted this to the scuffle in the restraint. He
denied anyone using inappropriate language towards Youth A.
Staff 2:
Staff 2 reported there was a code called during his shift on
6/24/24. He went to assist Supervisor 1 with Youth A. When he
arrived, Youth A had his fists balled up and flipped picnic tables
and outside grills. Youth A was threatening staff and stating, “I will
beat your ass.” Staff 2 reported, as he approached Supervisor 1
and Youth A, he noticed Youth A coming close to Supervisor 1
with his fists balled up but couldn’t be certain if Youth A jumped
towards Supervisor 1. Staff 2 reported Supervisor 1 attempted to
place him in a “high hold” and they both fell to the ground. Staff 2
reported the ground was uneven which may have caused for the
fall. Staff 2 reported he grabbed one side of Youth A’s arms while
Supervisor 1 grabbed his other side. Staff 2 reported Supervisor 1
tried to verbally deescalate Youth A, in which Youth A was not
3

listening. On the restraint, Youth A continued to struggle but was
able to calm down. Staff 2 reported he never saw Supervisor 1
grab Youth A’s neck or choke him, nor did he see anyone else do
this, including himself. Staff 2 was unaware of any marks on Youth
A. He denied anyone using inappropriate language towards Youth
A.
Youth A:
Youth A reported he was restrained by staff and could not
remember who they were. Youth A reported the individuals who
restrained him called him, “ho ass nigger” and stated, “I would
have shot you by now” and “fuck this nigger.” Youth A was
sporadic in his conversation and was more concerned about a pair
of shoes that he was missing from a previous placement. Youth A
reported after he was restrained, he went to his therapist and the
hospital. Youth A was able to verbalize that he was upset on
6/24/24 and wanted to have a different staff supervising him
throughout the day and did report he flipped tables and grills.
Youth A was unable to provide any other details to the restraint.
Youth A reported he received a scratch on his eye. (I observed a
slight nick on his right eyelid). Youth A reported he was not hurt.
Video Reviewed:
I reviewed the video (no audio) for 6/24/24. The video started at
3:33:27 and ended at 3:33:49. The video is consistent with
Supervisor 1’s interview. A standing hold was attempted by
Supervisor 1, and then a team control. Youth A and staff fell to the
ground, ending in a supine restraint. The video did not show
anyone choking Youth A.
Documents Reviewed:
• The agency behavior management policy outlines the
restraint techniques outlined in CPI.
• Supervisor 1, Staff 1 and Staff 2 personnel files pertaining
to training and clearances. All were up to date. There were
no discipline in the files.
• Incident report dated 6/24/24. The incident report was
consistent with interviews and video. The incident report did
not note a hospital visit only the onsite nurse examined
Youth A. The incident report does state, “has superficial
scratches on neck and face, areas cleaned, antibiotic
offered…”
• Nurse Note dated 6/24/24 at 4:45pm: “has shallow
scratches under right ear, right eye, left neck and mid
forehead. No bleeding, no swelling, no discomfort, still
4

appears agitated and uncooperative.” No bruises were
noted.
• Nurse note 6/24/24 at 8:15pm was sent to the hospital for
suicide assessment.
Analysis Based on interviews and video observation, the agency is
compliant. Youth A was aggressive physically and verbally and
staff engaged in an appropriate restraint for the safety of the youth
and staff involved.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
